decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling the Allosaurus Rider combo, utilizing cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. It also includes cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer for protection and disruption. The deck aims to quickly ramp into its combo pieces while controlling the board with cards like Consign to Memory and Planar Genesis. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents with its powerful creatures and combo potential.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive Boros creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm your opponent and deal damage efficiently. The key strategy is to maintain board presence with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while also using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the battlefield and deal direct damage. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides a powerful finisher, while Ocelot Pride and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury offer additional ways to increase your damage output. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thraben Charm and Elegant Parlor to disrupt your opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using powerful spells to control the board and deal damage quickly. It utilizes a mix of multicolored creatures and spells to maximize its efficiency and versatility. The deck contains cards that can both pump up its creatures and protect them from removal spells, allowing it to maintain pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Consign to Memory provides additional ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan and gain advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive strategy and efficient spell choices.

The deck focuses on assembling the Allosaurus Rider combo, using cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to tutor for key pieces. It also utilizes Nourishing Shoal and Griselbrand for card draw and life gain, as well as Pact of Negation for protection. Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant provide additional support and threats on the board. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and spells. It also includes various utility lands and spells to enhance its game plan and ensure consistency.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to quickly overwhelm opponents with fast and aggressive plays. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal, Engineered Explosives, and Arcbound Ravager, the deck aims to generate advantage with artifact synergy and explosive plays. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga provide additional value and card advantage, further enabling the deck to maintain pressure on opponents. With a mix of control elements like Metallic Rebuke and Tormod's Crypt, this deck seeks to disrupt opponents while pushing for a swift victory.

This deck utilizes a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and pressure the opponent's life total. Ragavan and Phelia provide early aggression, while Phlage and Quantum Riddler act as finishers. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to protect the board and stall the opponent's strategy, while spells like Prismatic Ending and Consign to Memory deal with threats. The deck aims to control the game tempo and win through a combination of combat damage and direct damage spells, making it a versatile and challenging deck to play against.

Utilizing Eldrazi creatures and ramp spells, this deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while accelerating its own mana production to quickly cast powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End. The deck also includes removal spells and land destruction to handle opposing threats, as well as cards like Talisman of Impulse to ramp up mana. By combining control elements with Eldrazi ramp, this deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and dominating the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, and Urza's Power Plant) to generate large amounts of mana, allowing for powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths to be cast. Karn, the Great Creator is used to shut down opponent's artifacts, while Ugin, Eye of the Storms provides additional control and removal. Devourer of Destiny and Glaring Fleshraker can also provide pressure on the opponent, while cards like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command offer board wipes and disruption.

This Boros aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to aggressively play low-cost creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, while using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to control the board and deal direct damage. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional creature support, while Seasoned Pyromancer helps with card advantage. The deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and finish off the opponent with a flurry of attacks and burn spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and overwhelming the opponent by deploying threats quickly. It utilizes a mix of multicolored creatures and spells to apply pressure on the opponent. The key strategy is to control the board with cards like Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact while using powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco to deal damage. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial to handle opposing threats. Finally, it combines aggression with disruption by including cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Consign to Memory to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on casting spells as efficiently as possible, utilizing cards like Ruby Medallion and Manamorphose to generate extra mana. The goal is to cast Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames to generate a storm count, allowing for a large Grapeshot finish. Reckless Impulse helps dig for combo pieces, while Wish provides flexibility in finding key cards. The deck also includes some land manipulation with cards like Gemstone Caverns and Valakut Awakening. Overall, the deck aims to create a powerful storm combo that overwhelms the opponent with a flurry of spells.

This deck focuses on aggressively playing artifacts and utilizing cards that benefit from having a high artifact count in play. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble help dig for key cards, while Urza's Saga generates additional artifacts. Metallic Rebuke provides counterspell protection, and Unholy Heat offers removal. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Quantum Riddler provide card advantage and selection. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a quick and efficient artifact-centric strategy, using cards like Haywire Mite and Cori-Steel Cutter to push for early damage and secure the win.

The main focus of this deck is to use aggressive creatures and powerful enchantments to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. By utilizing cards like Doorkeeper Thrull, Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, and Territorial Kavu, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game. Additionally, cards like Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact provide support for the creatures, while Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial can help control the opponent's board and protect key cards.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with the Urza lands to cast big Eldrazi creatures and powerful spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the game by using cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's hand and board state, while also utilizing cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Devourer of Destiny to apply pressure. The deck's win condition lies in casting big threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to close out the game.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to aggressively control the battlefield with powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while utilizing Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment for additional damage. The deck focuses on quick, efficient plays with cards like Guide of Souls and Seasoned Pyromancer to maintain board advantage and pressure the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Thraben Charm and Voice of Victory allow for flexibility in dealing with threats and protecting key creatures. The mana base is optimized for consistent and smooth gameplay.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful creatures and disrupting the opponent's strategy while taking advantage of strong removal and card draw options. By combining aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd with control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and removal spells like Prismatic Ending, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent while keeping the board clear. Consign to Memory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional versatility and card advantage, making this Aggro-Death and Taxes deck a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.
